intro: Phyllorkis mishmeensis, commonly known as the Mishme bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan region of India. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. It plays a significant role in the local ecosystem by providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for small organisms.
